snippet: Mr. Shakur had been granted a new trial because of ineffective counsel and questions about the methods and credibility of retired Detective Louis Scarcella, who worked on the case.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court Justice Desmond A Green rules Shabaka Shakur, who was convicted of 1988 double murder, should be granted new trial due to ineffective counsel and questions about retired Detective Louis Scarcella, who worked on case; orders Shakur be released from prison, where he has spent 27 years.

byline.original: By JOHN SURICO and STEPHANIE CLIFFORD

lead_paragraph: Mr. Shakur had been granted a new trial because of ineffective counsel and questions about the methods and credibility of retired Detective Louis Scarcella, who worked on the case.

headline.main: Judge Orders Shabaka Shakur Freed From Prison After 27 Years
headline.print_headline: Judge Orders Man Freed After 27 Years Behind Bars
